meanings.definition: The process of becoming brittle or fragile.
meanings.sent1: The embrittlements of the old metal made it easy to break.
meanings.sent2: The embrittlements of the glass were evident after it shattered easily.
meanings.sent3: The embrittlements of the cookie made it crumble into pieces with just a touch.
meanings.sent4: The embrittlements of the relationship were clear when it fell apart suddenly.
meanings.sent5: The embrittlements of the paper were so severe that it tore at the slightest fold.

meanings.definition: The state of being made brittle or fragile.
meanings.sent1: The embrittlements of the wood were noticeable as it splintered easily.
meanings.sent2: The embrittlements of the bone were evident in the x-ray after the fall.
meanings.sent3: The embrittlements of the ice cream cone led to a messy situation.
meanings.sent4: The embrittlements of the glass heart were revealed when it shattered into pieces.
meanings.sent5: The embrittlements of the leaf made it crumble at the lightest touch.
